intro: Coccocypselum glaberrimum, commonly known as the smooth coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and smooth, glabrous leaves. It typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
